title: Book Review: Active Statistics by Andrew Gelman and Aki Vehtari
text:
Active Statistics


This review introduces a new Statistical textbook for teaching research using the “active” approach. Active learning refers to how much one can “actively” engage in the learning process throughexperience. When one is ready to teach, she will learn the most.
The book is designed with lots of hands-on exercises - 52 of them. According to the authors, “52 stories, 52 class-participation activities, 52 hands-on computer demonstrations, and 52 discussion problems”. Basically, this book is designed for two semesters (13+13)*2!
Examples and same codes actually come from the Gelman’s other book Regression and Other stories

In a nutshell, this book is designed to engage students with :

lots of visualizations
class demonstrations
hands-on exercises
